page.title: 05Farming - Overall Aspect
page.content: There are 34 farms in this area,all owner-occupied except for one,which is uninhabited,though the land is let for summer eatage. The most predominant type of farms are those which grow crops for winter fodder and have dairy and beef cattle, sheep,pigs or poultry.Land not used for grazing is sown with barley and oats,or meadow grass which is cut for silage or hay for winter feeding. There are seven dairy farms which stock mainly Friesians.Eight other farms have Friesians and Charolais cattle fattened for beef. Sheep farming occurs on the poorer grazing land.The average yield of two lambs per ewe are fattened and sold for meat.Sheep are the hardy breeds which can withstand long,cold winters when they are buried by snow-drifts. There are also 2 large poultry farms.
